ibis.ipl

Interface MessageUpcall


  • public interface MessageUpcall
    Describes the interface for upcall based communication.

    Creating a ReceivePort with a MessageUpcall allows for upcall based communication. The ReceivePort must be created with the Ibis.createReceivePort(PortType, String, MessageUpcall) method, or one of its other variants with a MessageUpcall parameter. After the receive port is created, upcalls can be enabled through the ReceivePort.enableMessageUpcalls() call, and disabled through the ReceivePort.disableMessageUpcalls() call. Initially, upcalls are disabled.

    For a given receive port, only one message can be active at any time, and by default, the message is active as long as the upcall is active. However, the message can be de-activated using the ReadMessage.finish() call. This is the only way in which a receive port can have more than one active upcall.

    Note: to prevent deadlocks, upcalls are not allowed to block in condition synchronization or network access as long as the message is active. However, upcalls are allowed to enter/exit synchronized methods for critical section operations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void upcall(ReadMessage readMessage)
      This is the upcall announcing the receipt of a ReadMessage.

    • Method Detail

      • upcall

        void upcall(ReadMessage readMessage)
     throws java.io.IOException,
            java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This is the upcall announcing the receipt of a ReadMessage. If the upcall throws an exception, the message is to be considered finished. In this case, implementations should call ReadMessage.finish() or, in case of an IOException, ReadMessage.finish(IOException).
        Parameters:
        readMessage - the message received.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - may be thrown by any of the methods invoked on the message.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - may be thrown by a ReadMessage.readObject() call.
